definitions.definition: A revealing , especially a prophecy of, or the unfolding of, supernatural events.
examples: The early development of Perl 6 was punctuated by a series of apocalypses by Larry Wall .

definitions.definition: A huge disaster ; a cataclysmic event; destruction or ruin of large scope and scale.
examples: A nuclear apocalypse would have been possible if tensions went out of control during the Cuban Missile Crisis .

definitions.definition: The unveiling of events prophesied in the Revelation ; the second coming and the end of life on Earth ; global destruction.

main_definition: A revealing , especially a prophecy of, or the unfolding of, supernatural events. [from 14th c.]
secondary_definitions: A huge disaster ; a cataclysmic event; destruction or ruin of large scope and scale. [from 19th c.]
( Christianity ) The unveiling of events prophesied in the Revelation ; the second coming and the end of life on Earth ; global destruction. [from 19th c.]
